column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Tomato, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
column5: 3. Saute diced bell peppers onions and spinach until tender.
column6: 4. In a bowl beat eggs and season with salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Pour eggs over the sauteed vegetables in the skillet.
column8: 6. Cook on the stovetop for a few minutes until the edges set.
column9: 7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes until the frittata is set.

column2: Quinoa, Milk, Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Maple syrup, Chia seeds
column3: 1. Rinse quinoa and cook according to package instructions using milk.
column4: 2. Once cooked transfer quinoa to a bowl.
column5: 3. Top with mixed berries a drizzle of maple syrup and a sprinkle of chia seeds.

column2: Eggs, Spinach, Mushrooms, Onion, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Saute sliced mushrooms and diced onion until softened.
column5: 3. Add spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted.
column6: 4. In a bowl beat eggs and season with salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Pour eggs into the skillet over the cooked vegetables.
column8: 6. Cook until the eggs are set then fold the omelette in half.
column9: 7. Slide onto a plate and serve hot.

column2: Whole wheat flour, Baking powder, Milk, Eggs, Maple syrup, Vanilla extract, Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
column3: 1. In a mixing bowl whisk together whole wheat flour and baking powder.
column4: 2. In another bowl mix milk eggs maple syrup and vanilla extract.
column5: 3. Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed.
column6: 4. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour batter to form pancakes.
column7: 5. Cook until bubbles form on the surface then flip and cook until golden brown.
column8: 6. Serve topped with mixed berries and additional maple syrup if desired.

column2: Yogurt, Granola (nut-free), Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Honey
column3: 1. In a bowl or glass layer yogurt and granola.
column4: 2. Add a layer of mixed berries.
column5: 3. Repeat layers until the container is filled.

column2: Black beans, Corn, Red bell pepper, Red onion, Cilantro, Lime juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Rinse and drain black beans and corn.
column4: 2. Dice red bell pepper and finely chop red onion and cilantro.
column5: 3. In a large bowl combine black beans corn diced red bell pepper chopped red onion and chopped cilantro.
column6: 4. Drizzle with lime juice and olive oil.
column7: 5. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Ciabatta bread, Mozzarella cheese, Tomato, Fresh basil, Balsamic glaze, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Slice ciabatta bread horizontally and lightly toast it.
column4: 2. Layer slices of fresh mozzarella cheese tomato and fresh basil leaves on the bottom half of the ciabatta bread.
column5: 3. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil.
column6: 4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column7: 5. Cover with the top half of the ciabatta bread. 6. Slice the sandwich and serve.

column2: Quinoa, Cucumber, Cherry tomatoes, Red onion, Kalamata olives, Feta cheese (optional), Olive oil, Lemon juice, Fresh oregano, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. Dice cucumber halve cherry tomatoes thinly slice red onion and chop fresh oregano.
column5: 3. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa diced cucumber halved cherry tomatoes thinly sliced red onion and pitted Kalamata olives.
column6: 4. Crumble feta cheese (if using) over the salad.
column7: 5. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
column8: 6. Season with salt pepper and chopped fresh oregano.

column2: Chickpeas, Cucumber, Cherry tomatoes, Red onion, Avocado, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Garlic powder, Cumin, Salt, Pepper, Whole wheat wraps
column3: 1. Rinse and drain chickpeas then place in a large bowl.
column4: 2. Dice cucumber halve cherry tomatoes thinly slice red onion and dice avocado.
column5: 3. Add diced cucumber halved cherry tomatoes thinly sliced red onion and diced avocado to the bowl with chickpeas.
column6: 4. In a small bowl whisk together lemon juice olive oil garlic powder cumin salt and pepper to make the dressing.
column7: 5. Pour dressing over the salad ingredients in the bowl.
column8: 6. Toss well to coat everything in the dressing.
column9: 7. Warm whole wheat wraps according to package instructions.
column10: 8. Spoon chickpea salad onto the wraps and roll them up.
column11: 9. Serve immediately or pack for lunch on-the-go.

column2: Whole wheat pasta, Cucumber, Cherry tomatoes, Kalamata olives, Red onion, Feta cheese (optional), Olive oil, Lemon juice, Garlic, Oregano, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Cook whole wheat pasta according to package instructions then drain and let cool.
column4: 2. Dice cucumber halve cherry tomatoes thinly slice red onion and chop Kalamata olives.
column5: 3. In a large bowl combine cooked pasta diced cucumber halved cherry tomatoes thinly sliced red onion and chopped Kalamata olives.
column6: 4. Crumble feta cheese (if using) over the salad.
column7: 5. In a small bowl whisk together olive oil lemon juice minced garlic dried oregano salt and pepper to make the dressing.
column8: 6. Pour dressing over the salad ingredients in the bowl.
column9: 7. Toss well to coat everything in the dressing.

column2: Chicken breast, Broccoli, Bell peppers, Carrots, Snap peas, Garlic, Ginger, Soy sauce, Sesame oil, Olive oil, Rice vinegar, Cornstarch, Green onions, Sesame seeds
column3: 1. Slice chicken breast into thin strips.
column4: 2. Chop broccoli into florets slice bell peppers julienne carrots and trim snap peas.
column6: 4. In a small bowl mix soy sauce sesame oil rice vinegar and cornstarch to make the sauce. 5. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column7: 6. Add minced garlic and ginger to the skillet and cook until fragrant.
column8: 7. Add chicken strips to the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through.
column9: 8. Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside.
column10: 9. Add chopped broccoli sliced bell peppers julienned carrots and trimmed snap peas to the skillet.
column11: 10. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
column12: 11. Return cooked chicken to the skillet.
column13: 12. Pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables in the skillet.
column14: 13. Stir-fry until the sauce thickens and coats everything.
column15: 14. Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds before serving.

column1: Spaghetti with Marinara Sauce and Meatballs
column2: Whole wheat spaghetti, Ground chicken, Marinara sauce (store-bought or homemade), Olive oil, Garlic, Italian seasoning, Salt, Pepper, Fresh parsley
column3: 1. Cook whole wheat spaghetti according to package instructions then drain and set aside.
column4: 2. In a bowl mix ground chicken with minced garlic Italian seasoning salt pepper and chopped fresh parsley.
column5: 3. Form the chicken mixture into meatballs.
column6: 4. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column7: 5. Add meatballs to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides and cooked through.
column8: 6. Warm marinara sauce in a saucepan over medium heat.
column9: 7. Serve cooked spaghetti topped with marinara sauce and meatballs.
column10: 8. Garnish with additional chopped fresh parsley if desired.

column2: Lentils, Carrots, Celery, Onion, Garlic, Tomato paste, Vegetable broth, Worcestershire sauce (vegetarian), Frozen peas, Corn, Potatoes, Butter (or vegan butter), Milk, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Cook lentils according to package instructions and set aside.
column5: 3. Dice carrots celery and onion and mince garlic.
column6: 4. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
column7: 5. Add diced vegetables and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened.
column8: 6. Stir in tomato paste and cook for another minute.
column9: 7. Add cooked lentils vegetable broth and Worcestershire sauce to the skillet.
column10: 8. Stir in frozen peas and corn.
column12: then season with salt and pepper to taste.
column13: 10. Meanwhile peel and dice potatoes then boil in salted water until tender.
column14: 11. Drain the cooked potatoes and mash with butter and milk until smooth.
column15: 12. Transfer the lentil mixture to a baking dish and spread the mashed potatoes over the top.
column16: 13. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the mashed potatoes are golden brown.

column2: Beef sirloin, Broccoli, Carrots, Bell peppers, Onion, Garlic, Soy sauce, Hoisin sauce, Olive oil, Cornstarch, Sesame oil, Green onions, Sesame seeds
column3: 1. Slice beef sirloin into thin strips.
column4: 2. Chop broccoli into florets slice carrots bell peppers and onion and mince garlic.
column5: 3. In a small bowl mix soy sauce hoisin sauce cornstarch and sesame oil to make the sauce.
column6: 4. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column7: 5. Add minced garlic to the skillet and cook until fragrant.
column8: 6. Add sliced beef strips to the skillet and cook until browned.
column9: 7. Remove beef from the skillet and set aside.
column10: 8. Add chopped broccoli sliced carrots bell peppers and onion to the skillet.
column11: 9. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
column12: 10. Return cooked beef to the skillet.
column13: 11. Pour the sauce over the beef and vegetables in the skillet.
column14: 12. Stir-fry until the sauce thickens and coats everything.
column15: 13. Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds before serving.

column1: Chicken and Vegetable Sheet Pan Dinner
column2: Chicken thighs, Potatoes, Broccoli, Bell peppers, Red onion, Olive oil, Garlic powder, Paprika, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as thyme or rosemary)
column4: 2. Cut potatoes into wedges and chop broccoli into florets. Slice bell peppers and red onion.
column5: 3. Place chicken thighs potatoes broccoli bell peppers and red onion on a large baking sheet.
column6: 4. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powder paprika salt and pepper. Toss to coat evenly.
column7: 5. Arrange everything in a single layer on the baking sheet.
column8: 6. Roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
column9: 7. Garnish with fresh herbs before serving.
